page.title: 13Organised religion:buildings
page.content: There are{5}religious groups in the district. A small group of{Quakers} meet at the{Blue Idol Guest House.}In the village itself there are 3 churches and 1 chapel.{St.Mary's (Church of England) is the oldest & largest. Built on 12th c.foundations it has a wide nave and aisles under a broad panelled roof. It was rebuilt in 1866 and has Victorian {stained glass}apart from one small insert of 15th c. glass which survived the destruction of the{Reformation.St. {Gabriel's}(Catholic) was dedicated in 1981 but built a little earlier. The{ {Free Christian Church}(Unitarian) is a small red brick chapel set in a large 19th c. cemetery. The{Trinity United {Reform Church} has its roots in the breakaway 18th & 19th c. movements and is a large dark brick & unadorned hall with plain leaded windows.
